result.execSummary:
One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Tristan Ray Klump is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall pay $500.00 restitution and $50.00 restitution surcharge for a total of $550.00 within 15 months of the acceptance of the agreement by the Court.  Payments shall be made to the Monroe County Clerk of Courts Office.

Defendant's bond shall remain in effect during said Diversion Agreement.

Defendant shall file monthly written reports with the Monroe County Justice Department certifying the defendant's compliance with the conditions specified in the agreement.

The defendant shall provide any change of address information to the Monroe County Justice Department and Monroe County Clerk of Circuit Court within 24 hours of said change.

Defendant will pay a $20.00 per month Diversion Agreement fee to the Justice Program Coordinator or designee by the 5th day of each month.

Defendant shall meet in person with the Justice Program Coordinator or designee approximately every three (3) months while the Diversion Agreement is in effect.

Defendant shall appear in court at a review hearing approximately four (4) months after the Court's approval of the agreement.  The court will schedule the review hearing and send notice to the defendant at the most recent address provided to the Clerk of Court's office.

Defendant shall write an appropriate letter of apology to the victim in this case within 3 months of the acceptance of the agreement by the Court.  Said letter shall be submitted to the Justice Program Coordinator and if deemed appropriate, shall be forwarded to the victim.

Defendant shall have no contact with D.C. or his residence for the duration of this agreement.

Defendant to comply with all other terms and conditions of this Agreement.

timeConds.notes: Defendant shall complete 40 hours of community service within 15 months of the acceptance of the agreement by the Court and shall provide the Monroe County Justice Department, Justice Program Coordinator or designee, with verification of said hours.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tristan Ray Klump
